thread.title: Tom Brady named NFL player of the month
thread.title_full: Tom Brady named NFL player of the month | Boston Herald

author: Jeff Howe
title: Tom Brady named NFL player of the month
text:
After being passed over for three weekly awards, Patriots quarterback Tom Brady was named AFC Offensive Player of the Month by the NFL yesterday.
In leading the Patriots to a 3-0 start, Brady leads the AFC in touchdown passes (nine), yards (1,112), yards per game (370.7), attempts (133), completions (96) and interceptions thrown (0). In addition, he became just the fourth quarterback to throw 400 career touchdowns when he connected last Sunday during a rout of the Jacksonville Jaguars.
It was Brady’s eighth time winning the monthly honor, tying him with Broncos quarterback Peyton Manning.
In addition, Stephen Gostkowski earned the AFC Special Teams Player of the Month nod, the third time he’s achieved that. Gostkowski leads the NFL in scoring with 35 points. He is 7-for-7 on field goals and has hit all 14 of his extra-point attempts. Gostkowski set an NFL record for consecutive extra points last Sunday when he hit his 423rd straight.
In other news, the Patriots have filled each vacancy on their active roster and practice squad.
They promoted defensive tackle Khyri Thornton from the practice squad to the active roster. It’s Thornton’s second stint on the 53-man roster this season. They also officially announced the trade that sent Michael Hoomanawanui to New Orleans for defensive lineman Akiem Hicks.
The four practice squad additions included the re-signing of defensive end Eric Martin and the signings of wide receiver Austin Hill, defensive back Brandon Dixon and offensive lineman Sean Hickey.
